alert.note: Alert for Buffalo (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 22 at 11:53PM CDT until July 23 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Buffalo County in south central Nebraska... * Until 500 AM CDT. * At 1153 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. This includes the following streams and drainages... Elk Creek, Swenson Creek, Death Creek, South Loup River, Dry Creek, Deer Creek, Rusco Creek, Black Hill Creek, Wood River and Otter Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
